title: What Is Ether
description: A short lesson to help you apply What Is Ether.

hook.text: Ether is not the same as Ethereum. Ethereum is the network. Ether is the fuel that makes it run.

buildup.text: Every action on Ethereum â€” sending tokens, running programs, creating NFTs â€” costs a small fee paid in Ether.

discovery.text: These fees are called 'gas.' Complex operations cost more gas, just like longer trips use more fuel.

twist.text: Unlike Bitcoin's hard cap of 21 million, Ether has no fixed maximum supply. New coins are always being created.

climax.text: Since a 2021 upgrade, some Ether is burned with every transaction. Supply can now actually decrease.

punchline.text: Ethereum runs on digital fuel called Ether â€” and it burns some with every use.

quiz.question: What is 'gas' on Ethereum?
options: The fee paid in Ether to execute transactions
